title: 91/654/EEC: Commission Decision of 12 December 1991 on certain protective measures regarding molluscs and crustaceans from the United Kingdom
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 12 December 1991  on certain protective measures regarding molluscs and crustaceans from the United Kingdom  (91/654/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The United Kingdom prohibits the dispatch towards other Member States of batches of crustaceans and molluscs from Scotland.
2. The prohibition laid down in paragraph 1 does not apply to batches of crustaceans and molluscs taken from waters which have been approved to be free of toxine by the competent authorities or which have been subjected to analysis carried out by the  competent authority and showing a level of PSP toxine of less than 80 microgrammes per 100 grammes in accordance with the biological testing method.
The Commission shall follow the development of the situation and this Decision shall be amended in the light of that development.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 12 December 1991. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
